alert.note: Alert for King; Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 8:25PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Heavy rainfall across portions of Snohomish and King counties, combined with melting snow, may cause minor urban flooding this evening. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Washington, including King and Snohomish counties. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain continuing to fall across the area, with between 0.50 and 1.25 inches of rain falling in the last three hours across the advisory area. This, combined with melting snow or slush from recent snowfall, may be enough to cause ponding of water on roadways, especially if drains become blocked. Heavy rainfall continues this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
